body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Flutter New Project Action menu is not exist on Android Studio 3.0 beta 7
![flutter](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6225082/31560566-fcf4b748-b07e-11e7-971e-4b164c8f58dc.png)

## Version info

[✓] Connected devices

comment_data.body:
Hmm, is other Flutter UI contributed? You should see a Tools > Flutter menu, and the flutter plugin should be visible in the list of plugins in the preferences page. You may also check the IntelliJ log for suspicious exceptions.

/cc @stevemessick

I just verified that the `New Flutter Project` menu item is present in my beta 7 IDE. I notice you have older versions in other IntelliJ installations. If you somehow installed a version prior to 18 of the Flutter plugin you wouldn't see that menu item. Do you see the Flutter device picker on your tool bar? It would be under the menu in the screen shot.
Yes, everything work fine just like on idea/webstorm plugin. Let me try updating it in idea too

`New Flutter Project` still absent, I have updated Flutter plugin on IDEA and reinstall Plugin on Android Studio Beta 7, there is no exception on idea.log

I tried to reproduce this problem using Linux. Everything worked as expected. I notice that your New sub-menu has 13 items on it. Mine has 19 (including Flutter) and I took only the standard install options. One difference is that I used RC 1 instead of beta 7 of Android Studio 3.0.

Please try this with a clean install of Android Studio 3.0 RC 1, without importing previous settings, and using only the defaults. If that doesn't work I suggest contacting your Linux sysadmin. When you do a clean install, the first thing you should see after launching Android Studio is the Welcome screen. The second item on it should be "Start a new Flutter project".

Edit: I forgot to mention you can add plugins from the Welcome screen. It is on the Configure tool at the bottom of the Welcome screen. You'll need to add Flutter before it shows up in the Welcome screen.

I was able to reproduce this problem. You have some disabled plugins:
```bash
Disabled plugins: Android APK Support (1.0), Android Games (1.0), Android NDK Support (1.0), CVS Integration (11), Firebase Testing (1.0), GitHub (171.4249.39), Settings Repository (171.4249.39), Subversion Integration (1.1) 
```
Enable the first three to restore functionality.

title: Flutter New Project Action Not Exist
